channel.dc:description: Akaash Maharaj's projects, articles, broadcasts, and blog serving the public good and advancing the national interest. On politics, public policy, liberalism, foreign affairs, and equestrian sport.

item.title: Akaash Maharaj: The Raj, the Reich, and the Good Fight
item.description: During my trip to Delhi to ride for Canada at the Asian Championships, I had a chance encounter with the ghosts of India's independence movement, and a reminder that nothing corrupts the soul more than the certainty of personal virtue.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)

item.title: Akaash Maharaj - Globe and Mail: Unashamed to Own the Podium
item.description: Reflecting on my own experiences representing Canada in international sport, I argue that good sportsmanship and the virtues of sport are inextricably bound-up with the determined pursuit of sporting excellence, despite the scattered carping over the Own the Podium programme during the Vancouver Winter Olympics and Paralympics.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)

item.title: Akaash Maharaj - Projects: Tent Pegging with UNICEF Team Canada
item.description: Of my many eccentricities, none is as improbable as my involvement in tent pegging. Often referred to as equestrian skill-at-arms, the sport has a mounted cavalier riding at a full gallop across a timed course, on the flat and over jumps, using sword and lance to smite a succession of ground and elevated targets. Yes, really... Like most tent peggers, I was introduced to the sport through service in a cavalry regiment. Seat a man on a horse, hand him a sword, and set him off at a gallop: any ability to resist tent pegging will immediately abandon him.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)

item.title: Akaash Maharaj - Globe and Mail: Eric Lamaze and the Death of Hickstead
item.description: All horsemen know the proverb that for every rider there is one horse, and for every horse there is one rider. The death of Hickstead, the Canadian Equestrian Team's Olympic gold medallist stallion, has cast a pall not only over our team's prospects at the 2012 games, but more importantly still, left a void in his rider's life.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)

item.title: Akaash Maharaj - Advisory: UNICEF Team Canada and the Campaign Against Childhood HIV-AIDS
item.description: No one is more astonished by the results of the International Tent Pegging Championships than we are. My hope for the Championships had been to represent Canada with honour, and to serve the cause of the world's most vulnerable children. Having snatched victory from the jaws of rationality, our sense of dazed disbelief is unlikely ever to leave any of us.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)

item.title: Group Sword at the International Tent Pegging Championships - Akaash Maharaj Photocast
item.description: On the final day of competition at the world equestrian skill-at-arms championships in Oman, my horse Shomool remained in a surly mood. The rider to our left is keeping a considered distance, as Shomool had just attempted to deliver a slaying kick to his horse; Shomool's rear hooves came within centimetres of the intended victim. The warhorse's wayward bloodlust would remain with Shomool for the rest of the competition, and he seemed dejected that I insisted on coming between him and his wrath. A full account of the games is at my March 2007 blog.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.media:category: sport tent pegging FEI Olympics tentpegging horse riding equestrian equine cavalry horsemanship Canada international world championship UNICEF Oman Muscat
item.media:keywords: tent pegging, FEI, equestrian, Olympics, horse, equine, Canada, UNICEF, Oman, championships, Muscat

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: The Raj, the Reich, and the Good Fight
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: The Raj, the Reich, and the Good Fight
item.description: Gandhi and Bose were brothers in the hunger for justice, and both had followers who were willing to die for freedom rather than live as slaves. But one group was so blinded by passion for its cause, that it was willing to join hands with regimes whose very names have become bywords for evil in almost every spoken language on the planet.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Nothing corrupts the soul more than the certainty of personal virtue.
item.itunes:summary: An oft-overlooked aspect of the Indian independence movement shows that the path from hero to villain can be nothing more than hubris, and that no cause is so great that it should be pursued without humility.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Gandhi, Bose, India, decolonisation, independence, politics, World War II, society, imperialism
item.media:keywords: India, decolonisation, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, The Agenda, Gandhi, Bose, Indian National Army

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: A Meritocracy Worth Fighting For - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: A Meritocracy Worth Fighting For - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: Throughout our history, Canada has grown through the toil of generations of Canadians who were inspired by the belief that our country is free of the rigid class systems of the Old World, that Canadians' success or failure depends on our own efforts and our own abilities...But in recent years, we have come to doubt our faith in this meritocracy.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Canada was built on the dream of meritocracy: on the promise of better lives for our children and on the dignity of hope. It is still a dream worth fighting for.
item.itunes:summary: Akaash warns that Canadian society is in peril of ceasing to be a meritocracy.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, social justice, meritocracy, liberalism, politics, democracy, society, economics
item.media:keywords: Canada, meritocracy, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, The Agenda, liberalism, Liberal

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: Resistance is Not Futile - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: Resistance is Not Futile - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: In any democracy worthy of the name, it is not merely the right, but the responsibility of every citizen to resist unjust laws... but there is a contrast between making a scene, and making a difference. There is a choice between the comfort of self-righteous illusion, and the peril of self-sacrificing commitment. There is a hard journey between railing against unjust laws, and living out a life that models justice.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: In any democracy worthy of the name, it is not merely the right, but the responsibility of every citizen to resist unjust laws.
item.itunes:summary: Akaash argues that the credibility, virility, and nobility of the giants of civil resistance lay in their willingness to suffer the consequences from those their lives defied.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, civil disobedience, resistance, revolution, politics, democracy, political parties
item.media:keywords: society, civil resistance, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, The Agenda, liberalism, Liberal

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: Hope for the Holidays - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: Hope for the Holidays - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: We will be able to hold our heads high before the judgement of history if we can reply that in our season, we held on to hope, we put aside our doubts, we came together believing in our better selves, and we remembered that we have always burned brightest as a nation during the darkest hours.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Canada is possible only because ours is a nation where hope triumphs over experience.
item.itunes:summary: In his Christmas message, Akaash argues that throughout our long and storied history, the actions born of our hope have always been Canadians' greatest gifts to the world and to one another.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Liberalism, Christmas, politics, Parliament, elections, democracy, political parties
item.media:keywords: Canada, Christmas, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, The Agenda, liberalism, Liberal

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: To Lead or to Serve - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: To Lead or to Serve - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: Over the past quarter century, political parties have too often lurched away from being mass movements of individual Canadians sharing a common vision of the public good, and towards being backdrops for individual party leaders who speak the language of democracy while wielding near-absolute power over their elected caucuses.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Election to office is a contract to serve us, not a licence to rule us.
item.itunes:summary: Ultimately, active participation in the political process is the price that each of us must stand prepared to pay if we wish to be citizens rather than merely subjects. Because in a democracy, we never receive the nation we deserve; we only receive the nation we demand, and the nation we dare to create.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Liberalism, Liberal Party of Canada, civil society, civic participation, politics, Parliament, elections, democracy, political parties
item.media:keywords: Canada, Liberal Party, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, public policy, liberalism

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: Liberalism of Conviction and of Convenience - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: Liberalism of Conviction and of Convenience - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: The 20th century began as the age of the dictator. It ended with liberalism having come of age as the ascendant political philosophy across the world. Yet liberal parties everywhere are in crisis. Can they grow with the success of liberalism, or have they been outgrown by the success of their own political philosophy?
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Its long association with government made the Liberal Party a magnet for individuals drawn to power rather than to public service.
item.itunes:summary: If the Liberal Party is to have any hope of recovering, it will need to find the courage to resist the lure of comforting self-deceptions and easy answers.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Liberalism, Liberal Party of Canada, politics, Parliament, elections, campaigns, political parties
item.media:keywords: Canada, Liberal Party, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, public policy, liberalism

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: Faith in Secularism - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: Faith in Secularism - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: Speaking on TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I make the case that separation of church and state is as much in the interests of the church as it is in the interests of the state. However, upholding the ideal of the secular state often demands more courage than we might expect.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: If history has but one lesson, it is that when religion and politics mix, both are degraded.
item.itunes:summary: State suppression of free religious expression by free citizens is unacceptable in any secular democracy, and it is an offence against the free society that is the birthright of every Canadian.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, secularism, religion, politics, separation of church and state, niqab, hijab, tolerance, intolerance
item.media:keywords: Canada, secularism, Akaash, Maharaj, politics, religion, public policy, liberalism

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: The Arab Spring - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: The Arab Spring - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: In my broadcast essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I argue that despite our sometimes chequered history in the region, Western states have an obligation to enforce the Libyan no-fly zone, both to protect civilians and to ensure that the Arab Spring and the hopes for democracy in the region are not snuffed out in the killing fields of Libya.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arab Spring, which bounded in like a lion, is in danger of being led out like a lamb to the slaughter.
item.itunes:summary: In any one country, today may not be freedom's day. But that day will inevitably come. And when it does, Canadians will want to be able to hold our heads high in the knowledge that even in the darkest hours, we put aside our deals with the devils, and instead stood with the angels.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Libya, Arab Spring, no-fly zone, military, war, peace, conflict, peacekeeping
item.media:keywords: Canada, Libya, Akaash, Maharaj, war, peace, foreign affairs, Arab Spring

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: Truth, Casualties, and War - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: Truth, Casualties, and War - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: Videocast of my televised essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, on Canada's role in Afghanistan: Our ability to successfully conclude the mission and effect an honourable departure is being prejudiced by an ignominious political retreat from the truth: the truth about why we went to Afghanistan in the first place and what we are actually trying to achieve there... I fear that the current government is unwilling to engage in an honest national debate about our objectives in Afghanistan, because it believes that Canadians prefer easy lies to hard truths. But Canadians are not the fools or the cowards that such politicians take us for.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Canadians are neither the fools nor the cowards over Afghanistan that the government takes us for.
item.itunes:summary: Our ability to successfully conclude the Afghan mission and effect an honourable departure is being prejudiced by an ignominious political retreat from the truth: the truth about why we went to Afghanistan in the first place and what we are actually trying to achieve there... I fear that the current government is unwilling to engage in an honest national debate about our objectives in Afghanistan, because it believes that Canadians prefer easy lies to hard truths. But Canadians are not the fools or the cowards that such politicians take us for.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Afghanistan, military, war, peace, conflict, Afghan
item.media:keywords: Canada, Afghanistan, Akaash, Maharaj, war, peace, foreign affairs, military

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: An Injection of Moralism - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: An Injection of Moralism - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: In this, my second broadcast essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I argue that the efforts by the federal government to place emotion above reason and shut down Insite are unworthy of our country's better traditions and higher responsibilities. It is little more than an effort to purchase easy political popularity at the expense of a wretched and unpopular segment of society.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: The federal government's decision to attack Insite is wrong medically, it is wrong morally, and it will judged to be wrong legally.
item.itunes:summary: In this, my second broadcast essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I argue that the efforts by the federal government to place emotion above reason and shut down Insite are unworthy of our country's better traditions and higher responsibilities. It is little more than an effort to purchase easy political popularity at the expense of a wretched and unpopular segment of society.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, Insite, narcotics, drug policy, harm reduction, safe injection site
item.media:keywords: Canada, censorship, human rights, free speech, freedom of expression, commission, tribunal

item.title: TVO's The Agenda: The Rights of Vulgar Little Cowards - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.media:title: TVO's The Agenda: The Rights of Vulgar Little Cowards - Akaash Maharaj Videocast
item.description: In this, my maiden broadcast essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I argue that freedom of expression is too fundamental a right to be casually abridged, and that the Canadian Human Rights Tribunal must be stripped of its power to regulate public expression.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: The test of our convictions is our willingness to extend our most cherished rights to those least worthy of them
item.itunes:summary: In this, my maiden broadcast essay for TVOntario's The Agenda with Steve Paikin, I argue that freedom of expression is too fundamental a right to be casually abridged, and that the Canadian Human Rights Tribunal must be stripped of its power to regulate public expression.
item.itunes:keywords: Akash, Aakash, Maharaja, Maharajh, Steve, Paikin, TVO, Agenda, Ontario, freedom, free speech, Canadian Human Rights, Commission, Tribunal, censorship
item.media:keywords: Canada, censorship, human rights, free speech, freedom of expression, commission, tribunal

item.title: Team Canada Rides Again - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.media:title: Team Canada Rides Again - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.description: CBC Radio One's Fresh Air interviews me on whether Team Canada will be able to repeat our improbable dominance of tent pegging, the cavalry sport of horse, sword, sabre and lance, as I saddle-up to compete at the 2010 International Championships in New Delhi.
item.author: webmaster@maharaj.org (Akaash Maharaj)
item.itunes:author: Akaash Maharaj
item.itunes:subtitle: Demonstrating that it is better to be lucky than talented
item.itunes:summary: CBC Radio One's Fresh Air interviews me on whether Team Canada will be able to repeat our improbable dominance of tent pegging, the cavalry sport of horse, sword, sabre and lance, when I saddle up to ride for Canada once again at the 2010 International Championships in New Delhi.

item.title: Sword, Lance, and Adrenaline - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.media:title: Sword, Lance, and Adrenaline - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.description: Andy Barrie tries, largely in vain, to restrain his mirth as we discuss the upcoming world equestrian skill-at-arms championships in Oman, at which I will represent the country as a member of UNICEF Team Canada. The segment was originally broadcast on CBC Radio One's Metro Morning.

item.title: Politics and Principles - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.media:title: Politics and Principles - Akaash Maharaj Podcast
item.description: In the wake of the Quebecois Nation issue, TV Ontario's The Agenda asks if politics and principles are Canada's true twin solitudes. With Steve Paikin as moderator, Val Meredith for the Conservatives, Robin Sears for the NDP, and I for the Liberals.
